page.title: 15A Child's View of Maltby
page.content: Looking through the front door of my school straight across the road, I can see the village war memorial. This monument is in memory of the men who died during the First and Second World Wars.It is situated in a lovely spot because the rocks,fields and woods of the Crags can be seen behind it. Down in a hollow to the west of the memorial,I can see the parish church of St.Bartholomew with houses clustered around it. Behind the parish church is a busy main road that leads from Rotherham through Maltby to Gainsborough and Lincolnshire. On the far side of this road is a row of houses and the Comprehensive School,which is surrounded by large trees. These trees stretch high up the hillside. On the horizon can be seen the outskirts of Rotherham.The M18 crosses the view.
